name: Philip I Antoninianus (Obverse)
description: Silver antoninianus of Emperor Philip I (Philip the Arab), showing his radiate portrait facing right. The radiate crown with sun rays symbolizes the sun god. Graded EF+ (Extra Fine plus) with sharp details and attractive silver luster.
obverse_description: Radiate portrait of Philip I facing right, wearing the radiate crown symbolizing the sun god.

name: Philip I Antoninianus (Reverse)
description: The reverse depicts Aequitas (personification of Equity/Fairness) standing left, holding scales for justice and a cornucopia for abundance. A common and symbolic design on Philip I's coinage.
reverse_description: Aequitas standing left, holding scales for justice in right hand and cornucopia for abundance in left hand.

name: Greek Stater - Alexander
description: Gold stater from the reign of Alexander the Great. Features the head of Athena wearing a Corinthian helmet on the obverse, and Nike on the reverse.

name: Byzantine Solidus - Justinian I
description: Gold solidus from the reign of Emperor Justinian I, featuring his frontal bust holding a globus cruciger.

name: Athenian Owl Tetradrachm
description: The iconic "Owl" tetradrachm of Athens, one of the most recognizable coins of the ancient world. Features Athena on obverse and her sacred owl on reverse.

name: Persian Daric
description: Gold daric from the Achaemenid Persian Empire, showing the Great King in running posture with bow and spear.
